intro: Plicouratea granulosa, commonly known as the granulate plicouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, granular texture on its leaves, which gives it its scientific name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Plicouratea granulosa is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
